intro: Psychotria cerroazulensis, commonly known as Blue Mountain Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the cloud forests of central Mexico, particularly in the Sierra Madre del Sur region. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in montane rainforests. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
